Title: PhD Andreu Cecilia - Automatic Control Researcher at UPC
Description: Andreu Cecilia, PhD in Automatic Control, Robotics, and Vision, is a researcher at Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya (UPC). Specializing in nonlinear system theory, observers, and their applications in energy systems and cybersecurity.

Biography:
Andreu Cecilia holds a B.Eng. in Industrial Engineering, a double M.Sc. in Automatic Control and Industrial Engineering, and a PhD in Automatic Control, Robotics, and Vision from UPC. He has worked as a post-doctoral researcher at LAGEPP, Lyon, and currently at UPC. His research focuses on observers, nonlinear systems, energy systems, and cybersecurity.

Publications:
- Journal Papers:
  - Blending deep-learning and observers for improved state of charge estimation in vanadium flow batteries (2025)
  - Nonlinear observer for online concentration estimation in vanadium flow batteries (2024)
  - Cancelling output disturbances in observer design through internal model filters (2024)
  - A New Nonlinear Observer for Liquid Water Estimation in Fuel Cells (2024)
  - Real-time parameter estimation of polymer electrolyte membrane fuel cell (2024)
  - Estimation of the liquid water saturation in PEM fuel cells (2023)
  - Vanadium redox flow batteries real-time State of Charge and State of Health estimation (2023)
  - Modelling and Estimation in Lithium-Ion Batteries: A Literature Review (2023)
  - Online state of charge estimation for a vanadium redox flow battery (2023)
  - SoC Estimation in Lithium-Ion Batteries with Noisy Measurements (2023)
  - Addressing the relative degree restriction in nonlinear adaptive observers (2022)
  - On Addressing the Security and Stability Issues Due to False Data Injection Attacks (2021)
  - Nonlinear adaptive observation of the liquid water saturation in polymer electrolyte membrane fuel cells (2021)
  - Detection and mitigation of false data in cooperative dc microgrids (2021)
  - High gain observer with dynamic deadzone to estimate liquid water saturation in pem fuel cells (2020)
  - Optimal energy management in a standalone microgrid (2020)

- Conference Papers:
  - Quadratic abstractions for k-contraction (2024)
  - k-contraction analysis for discrete-time systems (2024)
  - Chaotic Masking Protocol for Secure Communication and Attack Detection (2024)
  - A masking protocol for private communication and attack detection in nonlinear observers (2023)
  - LMI conditions for k-contraction analysis (2023)
  - On state-estimation in weakly-observable scenarios (2021)
  - SOC and diffusion rate estimation in redox flow batteries (2021)
  - Library-based adaptive observation through a sparsity-promoting adaptive observer (2021)
  - PEMFC state and parameter estimation through a high-gain based adaptive observer (2020)

- Books:
  - Advances in Nonlinear Observer Design for State and Parameter Estimation in Energy Systems (2023)

- Submitted Papers (Under Review):
  - Generalized Lyapunov conditions for k-contraction (under review)
  - Dynamic output-feedback design for generalized Lyapunov inequalities (under review)

Teaching:
- Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya (UPC):
  - Non linear Control Systems (2024)
  - Modelling, Identification and Simulation of Dynamical Systems (2023)
  - Fuel Cells (2023)
  - Dynamical Systems and Automatic Control (2021-2022)

- Université Claude Bernard Lyon 1:
  - Automatique 1 and Automatique des Systèmes Dynamiques Linéaires 1 (2023)

Education:

- M.Sc. in Industrial Engineering, UPC (2017-2020)

Ph.D. Students:
- Energy management in hybrid storage systems (2023 - Current)
- Control-oriented cyber-security in electrical grids (2024 - Current)

Bachelor/M.Sc. Students:
- Data-based methods for cyber-attack detection (2023-2024)
- Data-based methods to ensure the safety of cyber-physical systems (2023-2024)

- IDinàmica del nervi ciàtic a partir d'ecografies (2023-2024)

- Implementació de controladors adaptatius amb identificació dispersa (2021-2022)
